questions.question: She was ………………………. than I thought.
questions.description: We use the comparative form before than.

questions.question: Although the house was …………………… I bought it.
questions.description: When there is no idea of comparison we use the positive form of the adjective.

questions.question: Is your grandmother any ………………………. today?
questions.description: The comparative form is used when change is indicated.

questions.question: Russia is …………………………… country in the world.
questions.description: We use the superlative form of the adjective to compare a person/thing with the whole group to which that person/thing belongs.

questions.question: She is …………………………. wonderful woman I have ever met.
questions.description: We make the superlative form of wonderful by adding the most.

questions.question: I do ……………………… work than you.
questions.description: More is the comparative form of much.

questions.question: She earns ………………………… than her husband.
questions.description: The comparative is used to compare one person or thing with another person or thing.

questions.question: We are not as ……………………….. as them.
questions.description: When there is no idea of comparison, we use the positive adjective.

questions.question: That was …………………….. unforgettable experience in my life.
questions.description: We use the with superlative adjectives.

questions.question: My sister has ……………………….. voice in my family.
questions.description: We use the superlative form of the adjective to compare a person/thing with the whole group to which that person/thing belongs.

questions.question: Which is ……………………….. bird in the world?
questions.description: We use the superlative form of the adjective to compare a person/thing with the whole group to which that person/thing belongs.

questions.question: Platinum is ……………………… precious metal.
questions.description: The superlative form of precious is most precious.
